Draw a rectangle by creating four lines with the following properties: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.195] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.195], End Point [0.0, 0.195] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.195], End Point [0.0, 0.0] *Extrusion* Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Extrude the scaled sketch by 0.015 units towards the normal and 0 units in the opposite direction. **Part 2: Side Panels** The second part to construct are the side panels of the prism. *Coordinate System* Use the existing coordinate system. *Sketch* Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw a rectangle by creating four lines, identical to the previous sketch. - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.195] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.195], End Point [0.0, 0.195] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.195], End Point [0.0, 0.0] *Extrusion* Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Extrude the scaled sketch by 0.5 units towards the normal and 0 units in the opposite direction. **Part 3: Top Panel** The third part to construct is the top panel of the prism. *Coordinate System* Use the existing coordinate system. *Sketch* Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw a rectangle by creating four lines, identical to the previous sketches. - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.195] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.195], End Point [0.0, 0.195] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.195], End Point [0.0, 0.0] *Extrusion* Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 1. Extrude the scaled sketch by 0.195 units towards the normal and 0 units in the opposite direction. **Final Shape** The final shape of the assembled CAD model is a rectangular prism with the following dimensions: - Length: 2 units - Width: 1 unit - Height: 0.5 units</description>
